Category.title: Category
Category.description: Represents a category for organizing content within the CMS.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Category entity.

slug.description: A URL-friendly version of the category name.

parentCategoryId.description: Reference to the parent Category. (Relationship: Category 1:N Category)

Tag.title: Tag
Tag.description: Represents a tag for organizing content within the CMS.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Tag entity.

slug.description: A URL-friendly version of the tag name.

definition.description: Stores category data. `categoryId` is the unique identifier for each category.

params.name: categoryId
params.description: The unique identifier of the category.

definition.description: Stores tag data. `tagId` is the unique identifier for each tag.

params.name: tagId
params.description: The unique identifier of the tag.

firestore.reasoning: The data structure is designed to be simple and secure. Categories and Tags are stored in their own top-level collections. This approach is chosen for simplicity and ease of management in a CMS context. Authorization is simplified since all categories and tags are managed centrally. Security rules can be applied at the collection level to restrict creation, modification, or deletion based on user authentication.
